parts.text: {"word":"dedicar","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"捧げる、献身する、専念する","english_definition":"to dedicate, devote, or offer something (time, effort, a work of art) to a person, cause, or activity.","examples":[{"sentence":"Quiero dedicar esta canción a mi madre.","translation":"この歌を母に捧げたい。","english_translation":"I want to dedicate this song to my mother."},{"sentence":"Ella dedica mucho tiempo a sus hijos.","translation":"彼女は多くの時間を子供たちに捧げている。","english_translation":"She dedicates a lot of time to her children."},{"sentence":"Se dedicó por completo a su trabajo.","translation":"彼は仕事に完全に専念した。","english_translation":"He dedicated himself completely to his work."},{"sentence":"Dedico este libro a todos los que luchan por la justicia.","translation":"この本を正義のために戦うすべての人々に捧げます。","english_translation":"I dedicate this book to all those who fight for justice."}],"collocations":["dedicar tiempo a (時間を～に捧げる)","dedicar esfuerzo a (努力を～に捧げる)","dedicar una canción a (歌を～に捧げる)","dedicar un libro a (本を～に捧げる)","dedicarse a (～に専念する、～に身を捧げる)"],"synonyms":["ofrecer","consagrar","entregar","aplicar","emplear"],"antonyms":["descuidar","abandonar","desatender"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","pronominal","definition":"専念する、従事する、身を投じる","english_definition":"to dedicate oneself to, to devote oneself to, to engage in, or to work in a particular activity or profession.","examples":[{"sentence":"Él se dedica a la enseñanza.","translation":"彼は教育に専念している。","english_translation":"He dedicates himself to teaching."},{"sentence":"Ella se dedica a la investigación científica.","translation":"彼女は科学研究に従事している。","english_translation":"She is dedicated to scientific research."},{"sentence":"Me dedico a la música desde hace años.","translation":"私は長年音楽に身を捧げてきた。","english_translation":"I have dedicated myself to music for years."},{"sentence":"Se dedicaron a reconstruir la ciudad después del terremoto.","translation":"彼らは地震後、都市の再建に専念した。","english_translation":"They dedicated themselves to rebuilding the city after the earthquake."}],"collocations":["dedicarse a la enseñanza (教育に専念する)","dedicarse a la investigación (研究に従事する)","dedicarse al arte (芸術に身を捧げる)","dedicarse al estudio (勉強に専念する)"],"synonyms":["consagrarse","entregarse","aplicarse","emplearse"],"antonyms":["desentenderse","abstenerse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin *dēdicāre* (“to dedicate, consecrate”), from *dē-* + *dicāre* (“to proclaim, dedicate”).","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/dediˈkaɾ/","syllables":"de-di-car"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["dedico","dedicas","dedica","dedicamos","dedicáis","dedican"],"past_simple":["dediqué","dedicaste","dedicó","dedicamos","dedicasteis","dedicaron"],"future_simple":["dedicaré","dedicarás","dedicará","dedicaremos","dedicaréis","dedicarán"],"present_subjunctive":["dedique","dediques","dedique","dediquemos","dediquéis","dediquen"],"past_subjunctive":["dedicara/dedicase","dedicaras/dicases","dedicara/dicase","dedicáramos/dicásemos","dedicarais/dicaseis","dedicaran/dicasen"],"imperative":["dedica (tú)","dedique (usted)","dediquemos (nosotros)","dedicad (vosotros)","dediquen (ustedes)"]}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Dedicar' is used to express the act of offering something valuable, such as time, effort, or a work of art, to a person, cause, or activity. It can also mean to dedicate oneself to a particular profession or activity. The reflexive form 'dedicarse a' is commonly used to indicate one's profession or main activity.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Yo dedico a estudiar.","correct":"Yo me dedico a estudiar.","note":"When referring to dedicating oneself to an activity, the reflexive pronoun 'me' (or other appropriate reflexive pronoun) is necessary."},{"incorrect":"Dedico mi tiempo en la televisión.","correct":"Dedico mi tiempo a la televisión.","note":"When dedicating time or effort to something, use the preposition 'a' (to)."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["dedicación (dedication)","dedicado (dedicated)","dedicatoria (dedication, inscription)"],"related_terms":["ofrecer (to offer)","consagrar (to consecrate)","entregar (to deliver, to hand over)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B1","frequency_google_ngram":"High","priority":"★★☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"The verb 'dedicar' means to dedicate or devote something, like time or effort, to a person or activity. The reflexive form 'dedicarse a' is used to describe what someone does for a living or what they spend their time doing. It's a common verb used in everyday conversations and writing.","priority":"★★★"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Voy a dedicar más tiempo a mi familia.","translation":"I am going to dedicate more time to my family.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"to dedicate time"},{"sentence":"Ella se dedica a la medicina.","translation":"She is dedicated to medicine. / She works in medicine.","type":"pronominal","meaning_category":"to be dedicated to"},{"sentence":"El autor dedicó el libro a su esposa.","translation":"The author dedicated the book to his wife.","type":"transitive","meaning_category":"to dedicate a work"},{"sentence":"Debemos dedicarnos a proteger el medio ambiente.","translation":"We must dedicate ourselves to protecting the environment.","type":"pronominal","meaning_category":"to dedicate oneself to"}],"regional_variations":{}}
